page.title: 07Winchester Cathedral
page.content: Winchester Cathedral is massive. The Nave was built by William of Wykeham from 1367 to 1404.His effigy is there. William also founded Winchester College. There is also a statue of William Walker, who 80 years ago, put sacks of cement under the Cathedral to stop it from sinking down into the marsh. There is also what is called the" Holy Hole" which is a door leading to St Swithun's shrine. In the Lady Chapel is Queen Mary Tudor's folding chair used when she was married to Philip of Spain . Because their wedding was very long , she had to rest on the chair. There are three different styles of arch Norman, Perpendicular Gothic and Early English The Cathedral was started in 1079. William Rufus was buried in 1100 and the Norman tower fell down in 1106.Was it an act of God ?
